newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bouygues in 1.6 billion Ffr Malaysia deal.
newsitem.headline: Bouygues in 1.6 billion Ffr Malaysia deal.

text.p: French construction company Bouygues said on Tuesday its Dragages et Travaux Publics (DTP) subsidiary has won a contract to design and build a new main railway station for Kuala Lumpur.

DTP is getting half of the contract worth a total 1.6 billion francs, a company spokesman said. Its Malaysian subsidiary, Dragages Seado Berhad, is leading a group composed of two local firms, Ekovest Berhad and KMZ.

The contract was awarded by Kuala Lumpur Sentral Sdn, which is made up of rail operator KTMB and MRCB, a firm active in television, electricity, construction and multimedia, Bouygues said in a statement.
The station will be used for mainline trains, a light metro and a high-speed train system. The station will be centrally located and have a total surface area of 207,000 square metres.
